title: Shrimp with Broccoli in Garlic Sauce Recipe
description: Shrimp and broccoli are stir-fried with ginger, garlic, water chestnuts, and a combination of soy and oyster sauces for a simple and delicious Chinese-style dish.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Seafood Main Dishes Shrimp Shrimp with Broccoli in Garlic Sauce 4.4 (102) 78 Reviews 41 Photos I wanted to recreate my favorite Chinese shrimp and broccoli takeout dish. After several attempts, here is the result! Serve over hot cooked rice. Submitted by AkronJoya Updated on August 15, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 41 41 41 41 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 cups fresh broccoli florets 1 tablespoon water 2 tablespoons peanut oil 4 large cloves garlic, minced 1 cup low-sodium chicken broth 1 tablespoon soy sauce 1 tablespoon oyster sauce 2 teaspoons grated fresh ginger root 1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined ¼ cup canned water chestnuts, drained 2 tablespoons cornstarch Directions Combine broccoli and water in a glass bowl; steam in microwave oven until slightly tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Heat peanut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Reduce heat to low. Add chicken broth, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and ginger root to the garlic; bring to a boil. Add shrimp; cook and stir until the shrimp turn pink, 3 to 4 minutes. Toss steamed broccoli and water chestnuts with shrimp mixture to coat with sauce. Stir cornstarch into mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes. I Made It Print 223 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Shrimp with Broccoli in Garlic Sauce 01 of 41 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 41 Photo by  PuffyMug2017 07/02/2024 Easy to follow I added mushrooms, snap peas and red peppers. Great dish and flavor on point. 03 of 41 Photo by  ChezBJ 12/04/2021 Stayed with the recipe, except for mushrooms instead of water chestnuts, and sprinkled with some red pepper flakes. Made good use of broccoli I grew in my garden! 04 of 41 Photo by  ChezBJ 12/04/2021 Stayed with the recipe, except for mushrooms instead of water chestnuts, and sprinkled with some red pepper flakes. Made good use of broccoli I grew in my garden! 05 of 41 Photo by  Genine Wright-Garner 03/19/2021 06 of 41 Photo by  Nicola Barbar 02/15/2021 07 of 41 Photo by  Monica Raimo 01/29/2021 08 of 41 Photo by  deedee 10/15/2020 09 of 41 Photo by  fara121 08/24/2020 Simple , satisfying and delicious ..everyone enjoyed the garlic shrimps with broccoli... but if you like spicy food then you need to spruce it up .. I added some crushed red pepper and green chilli and lemon and the dish was a hit .only difference I did was that I added stock at the end before the cornflour , so the prawns were sautéed in the soya sauce and oyster sauce ... yum 10 of 41 Photo by  Mary Perez 06/01/2020 Super easy to make and delicious. I made a slurry for the cornstarch rather than add cornstarch directly into the hot liquid. Turned out great. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Japanese-Style Deep-Fried Shrimp 351 Ratings Tuna From Can To Frying Pan 20 Ratings Shrimp Stir Fry 52 Ratings Baked Lemon-Pepper Shrimp 3 Ratings Tuna and Peas 12 Ratings Alaskan Cod and Shrimp with Fresh Tomato 202 Ratings Malaysian Lady Fingers (Okra) 1 Rating Shrimp in Avocado Cream Sauce 31 Ratings Steamed Garlic Prawns, Chinese Style 12 Ratings Tomato Basil Salmon 315 Ratings Broccoli Beef I 1,112 Ratings Smoked Salmon Pizza 22 Ratings Mediterranean Zoodles with Shrimp 6 Ratings Shrimp Fra Diablo 23 Ratings Chinese Take-Out Shrimp with Garlic 46 Ratings Kahala's Shrimp and Broccoli Toss 17 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: AkronJoya
instructions: Combine broccoli and water in a glass bowl; steam in microwave oven until slightly tender, 2 to 3 minutes.;Heat peanut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Reduce heat to low. Add chicken broth, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and ginger root to the garlic; bring to a boil. Add shrimp; cook and stir until the shrimp turn pink, 3 to 4 minutes.;Toss steamed broccoli and water chestnuts with shrimp mixture to coat with sauce. Stir cornstarch into mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
